page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: WALMGATE BAR AND THE SIEGE OF YORK. In the 17th Century Parliament decided to overthrow King Charles 1st.Charles called his side Royalists.Parliaments side were called Roundheads.In 1642 The Civil War began.The Roundheads battered the walls with cannons and set explosives.But only one went off destroying St Marys Tower.Finally the Roundheads hoisted their cannons to the top of St Lawrence's Church because on the ground their cannons could not break in.The cannons caused damage to the houses in between and some damage to the walls but they could'nt break them down.Finally the Roundheads withdrew to Marston Moor_ only to meet more Royalists.4,000 Royalists died and they surrendered. Today you can tell where the walls were damaged.
